title: Add prebuilt theming (multi-theme) across app
description:
Implement OpenCode-like theme selection but prebuilt-only.

Goal
- Support multiple prebuilt themes across iOS/Android/web.
- Persist selected theme + light/dark mode.
- Ensure primitives + navigation reflect active theme.

Scope
- Add a theme registry (built-in theme names) and runtime selection.
- Theme selection UI (simple picker screen/modal) + persistence (MMKV).
- Apply theme to:
  - React Native styles (iOS/Android) + react-native-web.
  - React Navigation theme adapter.

Design notes
- Current system is effectively 1 theme w/ 2 modes: `semanticColors.{light|dark}`.
- Move to: `themes[themeName].{light|dark}` (semantic tokens per theme).
- Provide `ThemeProvider` + `useTheme()` returning resolved semantic tokens for components.
- Keep Uniwind classes for layout/spacing; use theme tokens for colors where dynamic theming is required.

OpenCode reference (how they do it)
- Theme schema + resolver + theme loading: `/tmp/opencode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/tui/context/theme.tsx`
  - Built-in theme registry: `DEFAULT_THEMES`
  - Runtime generation: `system` theme from terminal palette
  - Selection: `config.theme ?? kv.get('theme','opencode')`
- Built-in theme JSONs: `/tmp/opencode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/tui/context/theme/*.json`
- Theme picker dialog + live preview: `/tmp/opencode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/tui/component/dialog-theme-list.tsx`
- Command wiring (`/theme` -> `theme.switch`): `/tmp/opencode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/tui/component/prompt/autocomplete.tsx`
- Initial mode detection (dark/light): `/tmp/opencode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/tui/app.tsx`
- Persistence store: `/tmp/opencode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/tui/context/kv.tsx`
- Config field `theme`: `/tmp/opencode/packages/opencode/src/config/config.ts`
- Docs + schema: `/tmp/opencode/packages/web/src/content/docs/themes.mdx`, `/tmp/opencode/packages/web/public/theme.json`

Local repo touchpoints
- Tokens today: `apps/native/lib/tokens.ts` and CSS vars: `apps/native/global.css`
- Navigation adapter: `apps/native/lib/constants.ts` (NAV_THEME)
- Color scheme hook: `apps/native/lib/use-color-scheme` (used by primitives)

Acceptance criteria
- At least 2 prebuilt themes selectable in-app.
- Selection persists across launches on iOS/Android/web.
- Switching theme updates primitives + NAV_THEME.
- No user theme JSON loading (prebuilt only).

comments.author: shady
comments.text:
Review notes (post-implementation):

Blockers
- Web support risk: theme-context uses react-native-mmkv unconditionally and initializes storage at module scope (likely crashes on web/SSR).

- Multiple remaining screens/components still use NAV_THEME + system useColorScheme, causing inconsistent theming.
- Android navigation bar theming does not update on mode/theme changes and still uses NAV_THEME; RootLayout effect is guarded by hasMounted.

Follow-up
- Created oc-c2e to track these fixes (web-safe persistence + Uniwind integration + NAV_THEME migration + Android nav bar alignment).

title: Implement Authentication Flow with Coder.com
description:
Integrate the Coder.com authentication flow into the mobile app.

### Requirements:
1.  **Onboarding Auth Screen**:
    -   Create a new screen/modal for user authentication.
    -   Input field for Coder Deployment URL.
    -   'Login' button to trigger the flow.
2.  **Browser-Based Auth**:
    -   Use `expo-web-browser` to open `{CODER_URL}/cli-auth`.
    -   This matches the CLI behavior, ensuring compatibility with all auth providers (GitHub, OIDC, etc.).
3.  **Token Handling**:
    -   User manually copies the token from the browser.
    -   User pastes the token into the app.
    -   Verify the token by calling `/api/v2/users/me`.
4.  **Secure Storage**:
    -   Store the session token securely using `expo-secure-store`.
5.  **User Session**:
    -   Store the fetched user info (from `/api/v2/users/me`) in `MMKV` for fast access.
    -   Navigate the user to the main app dashboard upon success.

### Technical Context:
-   `expo-secure-store` and `expo-web-browser` are already installed in `apps/native/package.json`.
-   `react-native-mmkv` is available but currently unused; initialize a global storage instance in `lib/storage.ts`.
-   The auth flow should probably precede the main navigation stack (conditional rendering in Root Layout or a separate Auth Stack).

### Tasks:
-   [ ] Configure `expo-web-browser`.
-   [ ] Initialize `MMKV` wrapper.
-   [ ] Create Auth UI screens.
-   [ ] Implement Token Exchange & Verification logic.
-   [ ] Save credentials to SecureStore and User to MMKV.

title: Fix theming gaps: web-safe storage + Uniwind integration
description:
Discovered during review of oc-38z.

Problems
1) Web persistence edge cases: react-native-mmkv supports Web (uses LocalStorage; falls back to in-memory if LocalStorage disabled), but we should ensure our usage is robust.
   - Reference: https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-mmkv#localstorage-and-in-memory-storage-web
   - Validate behavior for:
     - LocalStorage disabled (data loss risk)
     - Any SSR/static rendering path (no window/localStorage)
   - Current usage: apps/native/lib/theme-context.tsx

2) Theme switching does not affect Uniwind className colors.
   - apps/native/global.css only defines light/dark CSS variables.
   - Changing themeName currently only affects JS ResolvedTheme + navigation colors.

3) Remaining UI still uses NAV_THEME + system useColorScheme, causing inconsistent theming.
   - Examples: apps/native/components/container.tsx, apps/native/app/(app)/(drawer)/(tabs)/index.tsx, apps/native/app/(app)/(drawer)/(tabs)/two.tsx.

4) Android navigation bar theming does not update on mode/theme changes and still uses NAV_THEME.
   - apps/native/app/_layout.tsx, apps/native/lib/android-navigation-bar.tsx.

Acceptance criteria
- Theme persistence works on web + native; documented behavior when LocalStorage is disabled.
- Switching themeName updates actual app colors (Uniwind semantic utilities + RN styles) across iOS/Android/web.
- Remove remaining NAV_THEME usages in favor of useTheme() (or a single adapter).
- Android nav bar colors update to match active theme.
close_reason: Implemented multi-theme Uniwind integration with CSS [data-theme] selectors for opencode/dracula/nord themes. Migrated all components from NAV_THEME to useTheme(). Android nav bar now updates on theme changes.

title: Refactor Router for Protected Routes & Auth State
description:
Refactor the app's router structure and implement a centralized Authentication Context to protect routes, following Expo Router best practices.

### Objectives
1.  **Authentication Context**:
    -   Create a `SessionProvider` (using `useStorageState` hook) to manage auth state (session token, user info, loading state).
    -   Persist the session token securely:
        -   **Native**: Use `expo-secure-store`.
        -   **Web**: Use `localStorage`.
    -   Expose `signIn`, `signOut`, `session`, and `isLoading` to the app via `useSession` hook.

2.  **Protected Route Structure**:
    -   Refactor `app/_layout.tsx` to wrap the application in `SessionProvider`.
    -   Implement the `RootNavigator` in `app/_layout.tsx` to conditionally render screens based on auth state:
        -   **Authenticated**: Render the main app group `(app)`.
        -   **Unauthenticated**: Render the `sign-in` screen (or `public` group).
    -   Ensure the `SplashScreen` remains visible until the initial auth check completes (`isLoading` is false).

3.  **Route Organization**:
    -   Move existing main app screens (currently in `app/`) into a new route group `app/(app)`.
    -   Create/Move the `sign-in.tsx` screen to `app/sign-in.tsx` (outside the protected group).
    -   Ensure `app/(app)/_layout.tsx` is present to handle the protected stack.

### References
-   [Authentication in Expo Router](https://docs.expo.dev/router/advanced/authentication/)
-   [Authentication (Redirects)](https://docs.expo.dev/router/advanced/authentication-rewrites/)

### Implementation Details
-   **Context File**: `ctx.tsx` (or `lib/auth.tsx`)
-   **Storage Hook**: `useStorageState.ts` (helper for secure store/local storage abstraction).
-   **Root Layout**: Update `app/_layout.tsx` to use `Stack.Protected` (if on SDK 53+) or conditional rendering/redirects.

### Dependencies
-   Blocks: `oc-3sh` (The actual auth UI/logic implementation will depend on this structure being in place).

- Runtime-switchable font system for native + web.
- Native-optimized: embed fonts via expo-font config plugin.
- Web-ready: load fonts via useFonts (expo-font / @expo-google-fonts/*).

- Mono: IBM Plex Mono, JetBrains Mono (300/400/700).

- Add AppText + CodeText wrappers to enforce mapping consistently.
- Root layout gates SplashScreen.hideAsync() on fonts+theme+session.
- Settings screen provides UI to switch fonts and preview.

Acceptance
- Switching fonts updates UI immediately (no reload).
- Native builds embed fonts (available immediately at app start).
- Web loads fonts via useFonts and renders after loaded.
- Terminal + code review use mono; Nerd toggle switches glyph-capable fonts.

title: Cross-platform Design System v1 (Uniwind + RN ARIA)
description:
Context
- Single Expo codebase targets iOS, Android, and web (react-native-web) with one shared UI system.
- Styling should be Uniwind (Tailwind v4), and component behavior should be RN-focused ARIA hooks.
- We will port OpenCode UI tokens and component patterns into a new headless UI layer in apps/native.

Scope
- Build a headless primitives layer in apps/native and style with Uniwind.
- Primitives v1: Button, TextField, Dialog, Select, Tabs, Switch.
- Full keyboard navigation on web for Dialog, Select, Tabs, and app-level hotkeys.

Out of scope
- Desktop app UI (Solid/Kobalte) or direct import of OpenCode UI.
- Non-Expo web app (DOM-only) or separate codebase.

Dependencies
- Uniwind + Tailwind v4 for styling.
- RN-focused ARIA hooks for behavior and accessibility.

References (OpenCode design source)
- /tmp/opencode/packages/ui/src/styles/index.css:1
- /tmp/opencode/packages/ui/src/styles/colors.css:1
- /tmp/opencode/packages/ui/src/styles/theme.css:1
- /tmp/opencode/packages/ui/src/components/button.tsx:1

- /tmp/opencode/packages/ui/src/components/tabs.tsx:1
- /tmp/opencode/packages/ui/src/components/switch.tsx:1

Local app context
- apps/native/metro.config.js:1
- apps/native/app/_layout.tsx:1
- apps/native/lib/constants.ts:1
design:
Design approach
- Port OpenCode tokens (colors, radii, typography, spacing, shadows) into TS tokens and map into Tailwind config via Uniwind.
- Build headless primitives (behavior + a11y) and keep styling in Uniwind class recipes.
- Use RN-focused ARIA hooks for overlay/focus/listbox patterns and provide a web keyboard-first experience.

External sources
- https://docs.uniwind.dev/quickstart.md
- https://reactnative.dev/docs/accessibility
- https://docs.expo.dev/guides/customizing-metro/
- https://github.com/gluestack/react-native-aria
